source.e3f046be: There are null values present in Age, Cabin and Embarked columns, in which Age might be one of the feature of interest for our machine learning model. So, In order to train a model, the column should not contain any null values. It should be either dropped or imputed using various methods. I am going to impute the age using simplest method - impute using mean value since it's a continuous numerical data

source.1c1aee13:
<i> Null values in age column of both test and train data has been imputed with mean age from train data.

Reason: 
> 
You should use train mean for that. You should never infer information from test dataset as that's an information leak.

Calculating mean of test dataset would give your algoritm info about mean of it (obviously) and would probably falsely improve it's score on said.

In real life you would usually have no way to calculate mean of missing data anyway (think of single incoming example with missing values).
> 
    
from [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60131228/how-to-impute-the-missing-value-on-the-test-set)
